title: The Hybrid Dilemma
description: A fast breakdown of The Hybrid Dilemma for builders.

hook.text: Hybrid sounds like the best of both worlds. In practice, it often creates the worst of both.

buildup.text: Hybrid teams face 'proximity bias' â€” in-office workers get more visibility, promotions, and mentorship.

discovery.text: Research shows hybrid meetings default to in-room dynamics. Remote participants become observers.

twist.text: The fix isn't forcing everyone to an office. It's designing for remote-first, even when some are co-located.

climax.text: Remote-first means: all decisions documented, all meetings accessible, all communication async-friendly.

punchline.text: Hybrid works when remote is the default, not the exception.

quiz.question: What is 'proximity bias' in hybrid work?
options: In-office workers get more visibility, promotions, and mentorship
Everyone prefers being close to others
